header.title: META-MAGICK the Book of ATEM
header.category: Modern Esotericism, Chaos Magic, Psychology of Consciousness

central_thesis: The book presents a practical system for achieving new states of consciousness and influencing reality through the creation and manipulation of 'memetic entities,' which are conceptualized as self-perpetuating thought-forms. This is achieved by integrating principles of Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP), neuroscience, and ritualistic practice, offering a meta-approach to magic that allows practitioners to understand and 'remap their own minds' and create their own 'magical laws' rather than adhering to traditional dogmas.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part One: Invocations and Simple Evocations
structure_content.summary: This section introduces ATEM as a self-created memetic entity and lays the foundational framework of the system. It details 'The Six Elements of ATEM' (Attention, Language, Passion, Fitting, Trance, Making) and 'The Eight Powers of ATEM' (Communication, Neuroplasticity, Transformation, Transmission, Beauty, Understanding, Balance, Opening). It provides initial practical exercises, including invocations of ATEM, basic techniques for evoking and managing various types of entities (positive, negative, group entities), and methods for their destruction, establishing the core operative principles.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part Two: Thirty-six Days of Atem
structure_content.summary: This part outlines a comprehensive, experiential 36-day program designed to systematically explore and develop the practitioner's understanding and control over the Six Elements of ATEM. Each day features specific exercises focusing on a combination of two elements (e.g., Attention/Attention, Language/Passion, Fitting/Making), with the goal of fostering new states of consciousness, enhancing personal capabilities, and integrating the theoretical concepts through consistent practical application.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part Three: The Greater Evocation of Atem
structure_content.summary: Building upon the previous sections, this part describes a more advanced and formal invocation of the Six Elements. It details the process of 'activating your book' as a talisman for ATEM, suggesting that the physical book itself becomes an imbued magical object. Instructions for creating a sigil specific to ATEM are provided, marking a deeper commitment to and personalization of the system.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part Four: Creation of Memetic Entities
structure_content.summary: This section delves into the advanced theory and practice of creating one's own memetic entities, expanding beyond mere interaction with ATEM. It covers techniques such as 'Conscious Analysis' and 'Unconscious Revelation' for entity conception. It guides the practitioner through leveraging the Six Elements (Attention, Language, Passion, Fitting, Trance, Making) to develop, empower, and manifest these self-created thought-forms, including strategies for their perpetuation, transmission, and integration into both personal and collective consciousness.

key_concepts.definition: A self-created memetic entity, a thought-form that human minds participate in. Its existence is sustained by the attention given to it, allowing it to influence and interact with human consciousness. It is presented as a paradigm or system, akin to other widespread memetic entities like 'Democracy' or 'Cognitive Behavioral Therapy'.

A consciousness or unit of information based in memes (ideas, beliefs, patterns) that has the ability to spread from human to human and perpetuate itself. This concept replaces traditional occult entities (gods, spirits) with psychologically-based thought-forms that gain autonomy and influence through collective or individual mental engagement.

A meta-level approach to magical practice focused on the remapping of one's own mind, the development and transmission of memes to others, and the practical application of social change. It treats reality as a malleable landscape where new 'magical laws' can be created and implemented through conscious design.

The foundational components for understanding and manipulating consciousness and memetic entities: Attention, Language, Passion, Fitting, Trance, and Making. These elements serve as both analytical categories and operative tools within the system.

The key abilities or effects facilitated by ATEM, enabling profound personal and memetic influence: Communication, Neuroplasticity, Transformation, Transmission, Beauty, Understanding, Balance, and Opening. These powers describe the dynamic functions and outcomes of interacting with ATEM and memetic entities.

A system for understanding and altering human behavior and thought patterns. In Meta-Magick, NLP techniques are extensively used to identify and manipulate the internal structures of experience (submodalities) to achieve desired states of consciousness and manifest outcomes, forming a cornerstone of the practical methodology.

Specific distinctions within sensory modalities (visual, auditory, kinesthetic, olfactory, gustatory) that determine the quality of an experience. By consciously altering these submodalities, practitioners can change the emotional impact and meaning of perceptions and memories, thereby influencing their state of consciousness and the characteristics of memetic entities.

practical_system.description: The Meta-Magick system is an operative framework centered on the interaction with and creation of 'memetic entities' – self-perpetuating thought-forms. It utilizes a highly structured, experimental approach derived from NLP and neuroscience to achieve specific alterations in consciousness and reality perception. The core mechanics involve identifying, deconstructing, and reconstructing subjective experience using 'The Six Elements of ATEM' (Attention, Language, Passion, Fitting, Trance, Making) and invoking 'The Eight Powers of ATEM' to manifest desired changes. The system emphasizes direct experience, personal experimentation, and the practitioner's ability to 'design' their own magical laws and entities, leading to both internal transformation and external influence.
tools: Consciousness/Mind (as the primary interface for memetic entities)
The Book of ATEM (intended to become a talisman through activation)
Submodalities (specific sensory qualities of internal experience, e.g., visual brightness, auditory tone, kinesthetic pressure)
Sigils (symbolic representations for ATEM and practitioner-created entities)
Verbal Predicates and Sensory Words (used to articulate and structure internal experience)
Body movements and breath control (integral to many exercises and state changes)
Partners (for specific interactive exercises, facilitating shared experience and observation)
rituals: First Invocation of Atem (setting up the entity within consciousness)
Second Invocation of Atem (deeper interaction with Atem through elemental focus)
Simple Evocations (techniques for basic interaction, transformation, and destruction of memetic entities, including positive, negative, and group entities)
Thirty-six Days of Atem (a progressive daily program of exercises to master the Six Elements)
Invocation of Six Elements (a comprehensive ritual for internalizing the core components)
Evocation of Atem: Activating Your Book (transforming the physical book into a magical talisman)
Creation of Memetic Entities (a structured process for designing and empowering new thought-forms for specific purposes)

relevant_quotes.text: YOU ARE HOLDING IN YOUR HANDS A BOOK that in time will become something more than a book. In the words, the pages, the covers themselves, you may find the essence of a mind, a deliberately constructed form of thought and information and practice. In one sense, this book is an experiment in memetics—can we design and build an autonomous thought-form with the complexity and freedom of movement to perpetuate itself through the realm of human minds? If you are reading this now, the process is already underway.

ATEM IS A SELF-CREATED ENTITY THAT HUMAN MINDS PARTICIPATE IN. It is created, most importantly, of thought, of the attention of anyone who considers Atem for even a moment. This may seem a novel concept, yet there is precedence throughout history. Schools of thought, political ideologies, religious beliefs, corporate structures, forms of government, and much else depend on the attention of humans to exist, and they have built-in abilities to perpetuate, to include more humans, and even to reproduce. These self-perpetuating thought-forms, for our purposes here, are called memetic entities.
I DON'T BELIEVE IN TRADITIONAL MAGICK. Nor should you—especially if you want to learn to practice it.

Meta-Magick is an invitation to participate in several levels of practice: the remapping of one's own mind, the development of memes that can be transmitted to others, the use of media, and the implementation of social change.

critical_analysis.relevance: Meta-Magick represents a significant work within the contemporary landscape of Western Esotericism, particularly aligning with Chaos Magic and psychological models of magic. It deconstructs traditional magical concepts, reframing them through modern psychological and neurological lenses (NLP, neuroscience). By proposing 'memetic entities' as the operative 'beings' of magic, Farber offers a system that is accessible to practitioners who may be skeptical of supernatural claims but are interested in consciousness alteration and reality hacking. The book's emphasis on experiential practice and personal 'remapping of the mind' positions it as a practical manual for self-transformation and the conscious creation of personal and collective realities, bridging the gap between esoteric practice and applied psychology.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of practitioners interested in experimental magic, Chaos Magic, and those who prefer a psychologized, non-dogmatic approach to esoteric work. Individuals with an existing familiarity or interest in Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP), cognitive science, and neuroscience will find the theoretical framework particularly resonant. The book is explicitly not for those who adhere strictly to traditional, dogma-bound magical systems, but rather for those open to a flexible, self-referential, and constructivist understanding of magic and reality.
